messages.subject: Portland in the 80's
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/6/03 4:20:28 PM Central Standard Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/6/03 4:20:28 PM Central Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< I went to college in Portland, Oregon, in the late '80s. There was a
restaurant downtown, in Chinatown, that was open super-late, and people
tended to go there after a long night of drinking. It was called "Hung Phar
Low." Not sure if it's still there, but it was always fun to say... >>

I moved there in '87...Vancouver actually, but Portland was my stompin'
grounds until five years ago.
I miss those late night restaraunts, nothing is open very late here.


Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett
